page.title: 01Gazetteer.
page.content: The southern edge of our D block lies 10km{N.E.}Of{Plymouth;}much of the block lying within the{S.W.}corner of the{Dartmoor National Park.} Our area has two main villages:{Shaugh {Prior}and{Clearbrook}and the hamlets of{Brisworthy, Goodameavy}and{Hoo {Meavy.}Two rivers flow through the area; the{Plym}and the{Meavy}which converge at{Shaugh Bridge.}The area is mainly moorland, rising to 300m. Each village has a post office/general store and a pub. Most people travel into Plymouth for work, a few work within the area for the china clay industry. There are a few mixed farms. The whole area is one of outstanding beauty being very attractive to the people of Plymouth who flock to their favourite beauty spots, for{walking, {riding,climbing or camping}or just the peace of the countryside.
